Description: Long, rectangular, cream wool, weft-faced plain weave cloth; Decoration of tapestry (single warp threads) roundels in purple-coloured wool and undyed linen (9x5.8-6.4cm); Also a bar of purple wool near each of the two complete corners; Motifs are geometric with concentric ovals within, with a border of pointed scallops; Fringe (1.4cm long) is constructed from twisted ends and a line of chain stitch (formed from warp threads) lies along the top of the fringe; Warp: S spun wool, c.8tpc; Weft: S spun wool, c.37tpc, linen S spun Z ply thread for soumak outlining; Edges: two reinforced selvedges with bundled warps in groups of 4 then 3 then 2, plaited border one end, other end cut.
Curator's comments: Unreg. 92.; Similar techniques and motifs to EA72462; Plaited border similar to EA72465; Previously in grey chest in Students' Room and also cupboard P; Quality indicates clothing but shape of this fragment does not belong to any known garment type; Longitudinal folds may indicate scarf?; Information from Hero Granger-Taylor (21.5.1991)
